title:
Enhanced and Spectrally Selective Near Infrared Photothermal Conversion
  in Plasmonic Nanohelices
authors:
Juan A. Delgado-Notario, David L\'opez-D\'iaz, David McCloskey, Jos\'e
  M. Caridad
abstract:
We study the photothermal conversion in plasmonic nanohelices, unveiling how
helical nanostructures made from metals with a notable interband activity, such
as cobalt (Co) and nickel (Ni), exhibit a remarkable temperature rise $\Delta$T
up to $\approx$1000 K under illumination. Such outstanding $\Delta$T values
exclusively occur at wavelengths close to their localised plasmon resonances
($\Delta$T is significantly lower off resonance), and therefore the
photothermal conversion of these nanoparticles is spectrally selective. The
exceptional and spectrally selective temperature rise is demonstrated at near
infrared wavelengths, which prompts the use of Co and Ni helical nanoparticles
in a wide range of photothermal applications including solar energy conversion,
seawater desalination, catalysis, or nanomedicine.
